get.description:
List or search leads for a tenant.

Filters are optional and perform caseâ€‘insensitive substring matches.  Results
are ordered by creation date descending and wrapped in a pagination
envelope.

post.description:
Create a new lead for a tenant.

The ``X-User`` header supplies the identity of the caller for audit
purposes.  If omitted, ``created_by`` and ``updated_by`` are set
to ``"anonymous"``.

put.description:
Replace an existing lead.

All fields in the request body will replace the current values on
the lead.  Missing fields will be set to ``null``.

patch.description:
Apply a JSON Patch document to a lead.

See RFCÂ 6902 for details on JSON Patch semantics.  Only ``add``,
``replace`` and ``remove`` operations are supported.  Removing a
required topâ€‘level attribute (e.g. ``first_name``) will result in
a 400 error.

delete.description:
Delete a lead from a tenant.

Returns HTTPÂ 204 on success.  Raises 404 if the lead does not
exist or does not belong to the tenant.

get.description:
List or search companies across tenants.

If ``tenant_id`` is provided, results are scoped to that tenant.  Filters
perform caseâ€‘insensitive substring matches on company name, phone,
email and contact name.  Results are ordered by creation date
descending and wrapped in a pagination envelope.  The total
matching count is included.

parameters.name: tenant_id

schema.description: Optional tenant ID to scope the search to a single tenant
schema.title: Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional tenant ID to scope the search to a single tenant

post.description:
Create a new company on behalf of a tenant.

Admin callers must supply ``tenant_id`` in the request body via
``AdminCreateCompany``.  The ``X-User`` header is used for audit
purposes; if omitted, ``created_by`` and ``updated_by`` are set to
``"anonymous"``.

patch.description:
Apply a JSON Patch document to a company as an admin.

The ``tenant_id`` query parameter is required to ensure that the
operation applies within the correct tenant.  Only ``add``, ``replace``
and ``remove`` operations are supported.  Relationship changes
must be handled via the nested relationship endpoints.

parameters.name: tenant_id

schema.description: Tenant ID of the company to patch
schema.title: Tenant Id

parameters.description: Tenant ID of the company to patch

get.description:
Retrieve a company by ID across tenants.

An explicit ``tenant_id`` query parameter is required so that the
company can be resolved in the correct tenant context.  Raises
404 if the company does not exist in the tenant.

parameters.name: tenant_id

schema.description: Tenant ID of the company to retrieve
schema.title: Tenant Id

parameters.description: Tenant ID of the company to retrieve

delete.description:
Delete a company as an admin.

The ``tenant_id`` query parameter is required to ensure that the
deletion occurs within the correct tenant.  Returns HTTPÂ 204 on
success.  Event publishers do not include user information for
deletions.

parameters.name: tenant_id

schema.description: Tenant ID of the company to delete
schema.title: Tenant Id

parameters.description: Tenant ID of the company to delete

get.description:
List or search companies for a tenant.

Filters are optional and perform caseâ€‘insensitive substring matches.
Results are ordered by creation date descending and wrapped in a
pagination envelope.  Passing ``limit`` or ``offset`` will page
results accordingly.  The total count of records matching the
criteria is returned alongside the list of companies.

post.description:
Create a new company for a tenant.

The ``X-User`` header supplies the identity of the caller for audit
purposes.  If omitted, ``created_by`` and ``updated_by`` fields on
the company and nested objects are set to ``"anonymous"``.

patch.description:
Apply a JSON Patch document to a company.

See RFCÂ 6902 for details on JSON Patch semantics.  Only ``add``,
``replace`` and ``remove`` operations are supported.  Relationship
changes (company relationships and contact relationships) must be
performed via the dedicated nested endpoints.

get.description:
Retrieve a single company by ID within a tenant.

Raises 404 if the company does not exist or does not belong to
the tenant.

delete.description:
Delete a company from a tenant.

Returns HTTPÂ 204 on success.  Raises 404 if the company does
not exist or does not belong to the tenant.  The optional
``X-User`` header is ignored for deletion events; event
publishers do not include a user field for deletions.

get.description:
Return a simple status message.

This endpoint can be used by load balancers or monitoring systems
to verify that the service is running.  It always returns a
200 OK response with a JSON body.

Expose Prometheus metrics for scraping.

If the :mod:`prometheus_client` library is not available, this
endpoint returns an empty 200 response.  When available, it
returns the latest metrics in the Prometheus text exposition
format.

Return a list of unique tenant identifiers present in the system.

The current implementation inspects the Contact table to infer
tenant IDs.  In the future, a dedicated Tenant table or
projection might be used.

not exist or does not belong to the tenant.  The ``X-User``

do not include user information for deletions.

get.description:
List ticket forms for a tenant with an optional active filter.

Results are ordered by creation date descending and wrapped in a
pagination envelope.  Passing ``limit`` or ``offset`` will page
results accordingly.  The total count of records matching the
criteria is returned alongside the list of forms.

post.description:
Create a new ticket form for a tenant.

The ``X-User`` header supplies the identity of the caller for audit
purposes.  If omitted, ``created_by`` and ``updated_by`` fields on
the form are set to ``"anonymous"``.

patch.description:
Update an existing ticket form.

The ``X-User`` header supplies the identity of the caller for audit
purposes.  Fields not provided in the request are left unchanged.

get.description:
Retrieve a single ticket form by ID within a tenant.

Raises 404 if the form does not exist or does not belong to
the tenant.

delete.description:
Delete a ticket form from a tenant.

Returns HTTPÂ 204 on success.  Raises 404 if the form does
not exist or does not belong to the tenant.  The ``X-User``
header is currently ignored for deletion events; event publishers
do not include user information for deletions.

get.description:
List or search ticket forms across tenants.

If ``tenant_id`` is provided, results are scoped to that tenant.
The ``is_active`` filter performs an exact match on the active flag.
Results are ordered by creation date descending and wrapped in a
pagination envelope.  The total matching count is included.

get.description:
List support views for a tenant with optional filters.

Results are ordered by creation date descending and wrapped in a
pagination envelope.  Passing ``limit`` or ``offset`` will page
results accordingly.  The total count of records matching the
criteria is returned alongside the list of views.

post.description:
Create a new support view for a tenant.

The ``X-User`` header supplies the identity of the caller for audit
purposes.  If omitted, ``created_by`` and ``updated_by`` fields on
the view are set to ``"anonymous"``.

Update an existing support view.

The ``X-User`` header supplies the identity of the caller for audit
purposes.  Fields not provided in the request are left unchanged.

get.description:

Raises 404 if the view does not exist or does not belong to
the tenant.

delete.description:
Delete a support view from a tenant.

Returns HTTPÂ 204 on success.  Raises 404 if the view does not
exist or does not belong to the tenant.  The ``X-User`` header is
currently ignored for deletion events; event publishers do not
include user information for deletions.

If ``tenant_id`` is provided, results are scoped to that tenant.

ordered by creation date descending and wrapped in a pagination
envelope.  The total matching count is included.
